title: [K-12] Community of Practice (CoP)-Based Online Learning Program for Pre-service Teacher Professional Development

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic teaching-learning theories and elementary educational environments
context.additional_context: Emphasis on practical educational experiences based on sociocultural learning theory. Construction of collaborative learning environments using digital devices.

learning_goals: Enhance collaborative problem-solving competencies among pre-service teachers through community of practice activities

Through biweekly feedback sessions with mentor teachers, learners establish 3 practical strategies (code review methods, collaboration tool utilization, or problem-solving processes) to enhance adaptability in software development, apply at least 2 strategies to real projects (team or individual) within 3 months, and meet baseline standards in 2 of 3 project evaluation rubric categories (code quality ≥70%, collaboration efficiency ≥80%, problem-solving completeness ≥85%).

Preservice teachers complete 3 project-based assessments (web/app prototype development, coding instructional material creation, IT problem-solving scenario writing) over 1–6 months, fulfill ≥4 of 5 rubric criteria (e.g., functionality, creativity, pedagogical effectiveness) per project, and include ≥2 improvements based on peer/mentor feedback in their final portfolio.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
